Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

description: Business Process Parameters provide the ability to auto-submit to the business process.

Business_AssetObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_AssetObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_AssetObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Reference to an existing Business Asset that will be used for the Transfer transaction.

validation.validation: Business Asset Status ([asset status]) is not valid for Transfer.  Status cannot be Disposed, Pending Disposal or Received Not Registered.
There is a pending event for the asset that should be completed before this asset transaction can be processed.
validation.description: There is a pending event for the asset that should be completed before this asset transaction can be processed.

validation.validation: Discrete Composite Asset or Components of Non-Discrete Composite Asset cannot be transferred.
You can't transfer assets for the Type and Accounting Method of the Supplier Contract.

Asset_Transfer_Data.description: Boolean that when checked will keep the current Asset Share Worktags, if unchecked the worktags will be overridden.

The transaction effective date of the Asset Transfer.  The date must be greater than or equal to the Asset's acquisition date and must not be prior to the last issued date.  If the Business Asset is Depreciable, the Ledger Period must exist for the date specified.

validation.validation: Transfer date cannot be prior to last issue date, last transfer date or acquisition date, and cannot be after today
Ledger Period must exist for the Issue or Transfer Date specified for Depreciable Assets.
Select an Issue or Transfer Date that is on or between the asset's acquisition date and today.
The transfer date must be less than or equal to today's date.
validation.description: The transfer date must be less than or equal to today's date.

validation.validation: The fiscal Period for the transaction date must exist in the fiscal schedule of every company asset book where this is a depreciable asset in order to do this transaction
Transaction effective date of this transaction cannot be prior to last reclassification date for asset
Transaction effective date of this transaction cannot be prior to last partial disposal date for asset

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Transfer_Data.description: Reference to an existing worker or custodian of the business asset

Indicates whether the Location and Worktags values will be defaulted from the Worker specified.  1=default; 2=do not defaultIf defaulting is requested, a Worker must be specified while Location and Worktags are blank.

validation.validation: In order to use default values, a Worker must be specified while Location and Worktags are blank.

Asset_Transfer_Data.description: You must first configure the Maintain Worktag Type Precedences task to Not Default Worker Organization Assignments as Worktags for Business Asset.Indicates whether the Location and Worktags of the Business Asset remain.If you set this field to True, Location and Worktags must be blank. If Default Location and Worktags from Worker are also set to True, Workday merges the Asset Worktags with the Worker Worktags.

validation.validation: To retain values from Business Asset, the Location and Worktags fields must be blank.
You can't retain values from Business Asset. You must first configure the Maintain Worktag Type Precedences task to Not Default Worker Organization Assignments as Worktags for Business Asset.

LocationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Accounting_WorktagObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

For types that require a parent reference, the unique identifier type of a parent object.

Accounting_WorktagObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Transfer_Data.description: Reference to existing worktags. Worktags are a way to mark tasks and business objects to make them easier to access and summarize.  Each transaction can include one value for each worktag type and is subject to configurable validation when submitted for approval.

validation.validation: One or more of the worktags selected are of an invalid type for this transaction.
Only one worktag for each type is allowed for each document line.
Select a balancing worktag for Worktags of the following type: [type]
[missing worktags for spend and item]
[non-allowed worktags for spend, item and location]
'[worktag value]' is not permitted as an allowed value for worktag type: [worktag type] because it is inactive.
[partitionable] is not allowed to be used by [company].

Remove the values in the Worktags field if you want to transfer assets that share accounting worktags or enter zero in the Keep Worktags of Asset Shares field if you want to override share accounting worktags.
[invalid worktag value message]

Asset_Transfer_Data.description: Enter comments when necessary for asset transfer reason.

description: Data values and flags that will be used to update the Business Asset during the Transfer transaction.

validation.validation: Either Worker, Location, or Worktags must change to be able to transfer the asset.
validation.description: Either Worker, Location, or Worktags must change to be able to transfer the asset.

validation.validation: The following Asset Worktags are required but have not been assigned: [missing]
The following Asset Worktag types are invalid: [invalid]
You must enter 1 in the Keep Asset Share field if you want to transfer assets that share accounting. Enter zero if you do not want transfered assets to share accounting.
You cannot enter a value in the Keep Asset Share field when transfered assets do not share accounting.

You can't transfer assets using both the Default Location and Worktags from Worker and Keep Worktags of Asset Shares. Enter zero in the Default Location and Worktags from Worker field to transfer assets using the share accounting worktags or enter zero in the Keep Worktags of Asset Shares field if you want to override share accounting worktags.
